cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn west-northwest on Friday and approach the central Louisiana coast, then move northwest inland through Louisiana and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City, LA

weather_observation.within_uncertainty_cone: Yes – on the extreme western edge of the 4-5-day cone
weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge and Tropical-Storm watches from the Mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from Mississippi Delta westward through Louisiana and into far southeast Texas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible Saturday, with a 64 % cumulative chance of ≥34 kt and 29 % chance of ≥50 kt at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No surge watch for Texas coast; minor water rise of 1–2 ft possible on Sabine Pass during peak onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 in of rain Saturday–Sunday with locally higher amounts causing ponding and flash-flooding in low areas of the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat in outer rainbands; reduced visibility, heavy squalls, and short-notice berth closures likely.
